alert.note: Alert for Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:53AM EST until further notice by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Elyria. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Nickle Plate Diagonal Road inundated between Parsons and Whitehead Roads north of Carlisle Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to a crest of 17.1 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 12/31/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 900 PM EST.
